      • getAgent

        public LocalAgent getAgent(java.lang.String agentname)
                    throws InvalidAgentException
        Description copied from interface: LocalAgentFactory
        Locate and return the LocalAgent using the stored agentpackage and provided agentname. Ex: If agentname = "ComponentAgent" and stored agentpackage = "org.safs.jvmagent" then we will attempt to return "org.safs.jvmagent.ComponentAgent".
        Specified by:
        getAgent in interface LocalAgentFactory
        Returns:
        LocalAgent
        Throws:
        InvalidAgentException - if agent cannot be found/created/returned.
        See Also:
        LocalAgentFactory.getAgent(String)

      • getDerivedAgent

        public LocalAgent getDerivedAgent(java.lang.Object testobject)
                           throws InvalidAgentException
        Description copied from interface: LocalAgentFactory
        Locate and return the LocalAgent most appropriate for the testobject target. For example, if the testobject is a Swing JFrame we would return the LocalAgent from the current agent package that knows how to handle JFrames.
        Specified by:
        getDerivedAgent in interface LocalAgentFactory
        Returns:
        LocalAgent
        Throws:
        InvalidAgentException - if agent cannot be found/created/returned.
        See Also:
        LocalAgentFactory.getDerivedAgent(Object)

      • getDefaultAgent

        public LocalAgent getDefaultAgent()
                           throws InvalidAgentException
        By default we attempt to return a DEFAULT_AGENT_NAME instance from agentpackage.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultAgent in interface LocalAgentFactory
        Returns:
        LocalAgent
        Throws:
        InvalidAgentException - if agent cannot be found/created/returned.

      • getLocalAgent

        public LocalAgent getLocalAgent(java.lang.String fullclassname)
                         throws InvalidAgentException
        Return the LocalAgent for the fully specified agentclass.
        Specified by:
        getLocalAgent in interface LocalAgentFactory
        Parameters:
        agentclass - the full proper class name for the desired LocalAgent. The internal agent package is ignored.
        Returns:
        LocalAgent
        Throws:
        InvalidAgentException - if agent cannot be found/created/returned.
